column4: I just bought a new comp. It has windows XP. I have linux installed on this comp. I want to somehow get linux onto the new comp, and get the XP onto this one, so that I can sell it. How would I do that? IDE vs SATA HD...
use ghost to image the drives.
hmm... thanks :D
have a link to a free ghost app?
ghost4linux is free.
and... I.. just burn it to the CD... and then I can ghost the Windows install... and then... what do I do? boot from the CD to copy the windows image to the new HD?
ideally you would stick your windows disk in your linux machine, ghost it, redeploy it and then deploy your linux ghost image back to your empty windows drive.
kk... thanks
is there a way I can do it from a bootable CD?
you could google for a rescue cd with ghost on it.
ghost4unix is a boot cd, thanks :D
sweet deal.
man rdiff ;)
ah, never knew such a thing existed
